New Records: India won by 86 runs, the largest margin of victory in the series.
Nitish Kumar Reddy scored 74 off 34 balls, his first half-century in T20Is.
Rinku Singh got to his third T20I fifty at almost two a ball.
Key Match Events: India's spinners finished the job with miserly and incisive spells.
Rishad Hossain was slog-swept for six by Rinku, and then Mahmudulllah offered the free-hit.
Mehidy suffered the worst punishment as he couldn't get Reddy off strike and kept bowling in his wheelhouse for 26 runs in the 13th over.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh said they wanted to use the dew coming in later to their advantage and chase, India said they wanted to bat first to test their bowlers in dew.
Post-Match Reflections: India sealed the series win with a 86-run victory.
Nitish Kumar Reddy made an all-round splash with his 74 off 34 balls and two wickets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The India bowling still proved too good for Bangladesh, despite the batting conditions improving for the visitors.
Bangladesh's spinners conceded 116 in their eight overs, while the India spinners rubbed it in for them with nine overs for just 49 runs and five wickets.
